CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: BIRR hal Bisa Crl.MC.No. 8225 of 2018 2 201MKERISA3 ORDER This petition is filed under Section 482 of the Cr.P.C. 2. The petitioner herein is the accused in Crime No.803 of 2018 registered at the Alathur Police Station under Sections 447, 354, 354A(2) and 506(i) of the IPC. 3. By order dated 05.10.2018, the petitioner was granted bail by this Court subject to various conditions. One of the conditions required him to surrender his passport before the learned Magistrate. It appears that the petitioner filed an application seeking release of the passport. The learned Magistrate by Annexure-C order rejected the prayer by holding that the petitioner would evade the proceedings. 4. Heard the learned counsel appearing for the petitioner, who submitted that the petitioner was employed abroad and he would get his job Visa extended for a further period only if he gets back his passport and goes abroad for a short visit. The learned Public Prosecutor does not raise any serious objection. It is, however, submitted that stringent conditions be imposed to ralesarced ia aa Crl.MC.No. 8225 of 2018 3 201/KERIS4S ensure that the petitioner herein is available as and when his presence is required. 5. I have considered the submissions advanced. Having regard to the facts and circumstances, this petition is disposed of directing the court below to release the passport to the petitioner and to permit him to go abroad for a period of six months on his executing a bond for Rs.25,000/- (Rupees Twenty five thousand only) with two solvent sureties each for the like sum to the satisfaction of the court below. The release of passport shall be subject to the following conditions: - 1. The passport of the petitioner shall be released to him for a period of six months. The petitioner shall give an undertaking before the learned Magistrate that he will return the passport before the Court within the said period from the date of obtaining release of the passport from Court. 2. The petitioner shall submit his VISA and passport details before the court below and also furnish his address abroad. He shall also give the name and other particulars, including mobile phone number etc. of his local Advocate, who could be contacted by the Court or the Investigating officer for issuing any direction to the petitioner. If the petitioner requires the passport to be released for a further period, he shall seek appropriate orders from the Court where the case against him is pending.
